headline.main: INVASION PLANES URGED BY HALIFAX; Every American Bomber Now Is 'Worth Weight in Gold,' British Envoy Declares

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 -- Viscount Halifax, emphasizing at a press conference today the need of aircraft to prepare for the eventual British offensive on the Continent, said that one bomber in 1941 was worth two or three in 1942.
abstract: Halifax stresses Brit reliance on U S plane output
snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 -- Viscount Halifax, emphasizing at a press conference today the need of aircraft to prepare for the eventual British offensive on the Continent, said that one bomber in 1941 was worth two or three in 1942....

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
